newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African shares end firm in futures-related trade.
newsitem.headline: S.African shares end firm in futures-related trade.

text.p: South African industrial shares ended firm in brisk trade amid heavy volumes, bouyed by futures-related activity. Golds ended easier, dragged down by a softer bullion price.
Dealers said 52.9 million shares valued at 470 million rand changed hands during the day.
A firmer Wall Street on Tuesday night, contrary to expectations, sent players taking cover, dealers said.
They said the stable rand and stronger bonds also assisted sentiment but futures players dominated the market ahead of the close-out on September 16.
The overall index gained 66.8 points to 6,771.9 points, the industrial index rose 84.7 points to 7,943.6 points and the gold index slipped four points to 1,802 points.
